item.description:
Hi Everyone,

Weather: GOOD ENOUGH,   Saturday: Partly sunny, with a high near 76. Southwest wind between 3 and 10 mph. 

 

This is a paddle event to pick out the best of the spots in this area for next year.

This is the closest i will approach East Haven.

If you are worried about miles, (its too many), if you are worried about how much time, (its too Long) , but if you are interested it may be not enough of either.I do not like to give the miles or time because i do not know, its not like a hiking trail at a set speed,

We set our own courses, stop in places, and vary our speed, when its time to eat , then its head em up, movem out, Wishbone will be readying up the Chuck Wagon..

 

The tide change most likely will make the trip through the tidegate difficult, however this is a check out this gate in different tides but  will also go up to the right branch to the Trolley tracks.

--------------------------------------------------------------------

* POTLUCK BARBIE-Q SPOT HAS 2 OPTIONS:- 

1) *CIP*  WHICH IS 11 miles AWAY (EXCELLENT LOCATION WITH ABILITY TO HAVE A FIRE SIDE BARBIE-Q)

-OR-

2) NORTH FARMS PARK WHICH IS 6 miles AWAY (SIMPLE LOCATION WITH PAVILION AND BALL FIELD)

PLEASE INDICATE YOUR PREFERENCE.

Right after the paddle event we will actually choose which one..

GPS addresses supplied at the event.

By now you should have a GPS.

------------------------------------------------------------------

This event will include a few stops to explore some of the  Farm River:

*        http://www.friendsoffarmriver.org/FFREMapBrchr5.pdf

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Enlarged pic of above: 

http://photos1.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/b/8/b/1/highres_50327281.jpeg

 

-

Farm River State Park:  

( http://www.lisrc.uconn.edu/coastalaccess/site.asp?siteid=16 ),

The Farm River Tide Gate sounds interesting during tide changes and any other interesting spots for next years event listings will be looked at to pick out the best of them.

Included are Picking out a special beach spot at Kelseys Island..etc..

There should be only some current in the tide gate around 10 am area but it will be increasing a lot by the time we get there by 1:30 pm or so.

Tides for Branford, Branford River starting with September 3, 2011.

Day        High      Tide  Height   Sunrise    Moon  Time      % Moon
           /Low      Time    Feet    Sunset                    Visible

Sa   3     High   3:40 AM     6.2   6:19 AM    Rise  1:03 PM      29
     3      
 
 

Low   9:44 AM
     0.1   7:21 PM     Set 10:38 PM
     3     
 
 

High   4:05 PM
     6.9 <~~~~~~~~~~
     3      Low  10:31 PM     0.1

 

Rain, high winds, or bad sea conditions cancells this SATURDAY event:

It may be re-listed for Sunday if needed.

----------------------------------------------------------------

Weather:

Air:  http://www.usairnet.com/cgi-bin/launch/code.cgi?Submit=Go&sta=KHVN&state=CT

Sea:  http://forecast.weather.gov/MapClick.php?lat=41.2602591693733&lon=-72.784423828125&site=okx&unit=0&lg=en&FcstType=text

 

-------------------------------------

Chart:

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Enlarged pic of above:

http://photos3.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/b/9/b/5/highres_50327541.jpeg

---------------------------------------------------------

 GETTING THERE:

From Hartford, CT:

Take I-91 south to New Haven Area (Stay far LEFT near this interchange to avoid the traffick somewhat)

Then merge onto I- 95 NORTH interchange Follow I- 95 NORTH for apx 4.5 miles to exit # 53 (Branford Connector)

Take the connector to the end.

Take a RIGHT onto rte 1 Then an Immediate LEFT onto rte 142 = (Short View Road)

Take the 4 th left street = (STANNARD Rd) and go apx 0.75 miles to the boat ramp on LEFT (Stannard changes into GOODSELL POINT RD near the boat launch,

Follow the boat ramp sings. the signs may be located on the road a bit different than the directions but i gave the least road changes..etc..

OR Just follow your GPS and look at your maps to have a mental picture in your mind for alternate roots if necessary..

apx #38 Goodsell Point Rd Branford CT

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Kayaks available: PLEASE CHOOSE THE ONE YOU FIT IN OR CAN HANDLE and indicate that in your RSVP area, i find keeping track via the comments on the bottom of the event or e mail to be very difficult since i get so many of them bout all kind of requests and it does not reflect changes in RSVP'ees..

Please understand i can only carry 7 total and prefer to have enough for those that reserved and also not to have any sitting un supervised in the parking lot or left on the boat ramp.

ANY of MY KAYAKS need to be reserved prior to me leaving for the PADDLE SITE preferably by the night prior to or the event: (i may not get a chance to check MEETUP.COM in the morning of the event and there is the pre-travel time..etc for me to get busy with).

Yes its a STRAPPING & WAPPING         **       $20.00**   PER FULL DAY for kayak types, brands and special equipment you simply can not get from any other source.

(This is really a donation i do need to maintain, repair, and add new equipment over time. it also covers the costs of the "Decent Quality" boats with        all the Special Accessories including the transportation to and from the site, etc.)

Or you can rent the DURABLE Plastic ones they have at  http://www.cckstore.com/rentals/rentals.htm 

(or where ever else you get them) for a $50+ price range and you get to clean and load-unload them yourself on your own car if my yaks are not OK for you.

If you have a lot of money, a junky car that ya don't care if the roof caves in a bit, and think that dragging some Hunk of plastic on the rough tar all the way down the boat ramp to the water is how you portage to the water, oh i forgot..if you  stand on the floor to get in and moving your fat azz back and forth on the plastic seat like you are scraping off your hemmeroids till you finally get to and in the water is how experts do it, then ya better rent from Collinsville or someone else.

-------------------------


I have some cheap life jackets and some GOOD ones, (Remember a decent life jacket should be a top quality one, its really a form of cheap life insurance so you can enjoy your life in the long run).      
Everyone's favourite is the Medium Kokatat* Ladies MsFit Tour: (this is also purchased by guys since it has a great fit and versatility) Its really too small for me, but i like the way it works and feels.

Many ladies in the group have tried this one and now own the exact model also.

http://www.rei.com/product/751058

&  another TWO i chose for me and you is :   

http://www.watersports.co/womens-kayak-life-vests/c1000001793/stohlquist-towmotion-womens-kayak-life-jacket-2010-p219446.html

and

http://www.backcountry.com/kokatat-outfit-tour-personal-flotation-device?CMP_SKU=KOK0096&MER=0406&CMP_ID=SH_FRO001&mv_pc=r126&mr:trackingCode=78A4AEC8-8E50-E011-9324-0019B9C043EB&mr:referralID=NA     

When using my boats you have to wear the life jacket, i can not be responsible for your stupidity if you don't since its common knowledge to practice safety in this and ALL OTHER paddling groups since the unexpected happens too often.

Besides, i spent over $100 on some of these jackets for your safety, don't stuff the life jacket in the back somewhere by your azz.

I want to see your head above the water and that other part of your body can stay hidden down in the water.

I don't think you want me to take a picture of only your azz bobbing up and down with a life jacket floating by it for your funeral, the picture may say something in a unflattering way.

####       
All my yaks come with the TOP RATED Werner Carbon Kalliste Paddles because they are Hollow and light (my recommended brand and type). Different lengths (220-230) and types (strait, or ergonomic bent, small and normal shaft dia's.)      
You choose your preference.

http://www.wernerpaddles.com/paddles/touring/performance_core/kalliste/
####

Also for comfort is my favourite "Yak Pad's" optional accessory to all yaks on trips that we are actually going somewhere. 

http://www.yakpads.com/11-paddle-saddle-with-high-backrest.html                
####

BOW DECK BAGS are now placed on kayaks to hold water , accessories and other items needed for quick and easy access:

http://www.kayakproshop.com/SL_deckbag.html

 

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ 

PLEASE read some of the information on the hyperlinks below for the kayak specs and then INDICATE WHICH KAYAK YOU FIT IN AND OR CAN HANDLE in your RSVP if you need one of the following Yaks:

( I will do what i can to SUGGEST WHICH ONE IF NEEDED based on your physical size and skills if you are not sure).

 

KAYAK #1:       Eddyline Wind Dancer Fiberglass/Kevlar, Red, Rudder Equipped 18' @ 24" wide. This is an older expedition style sea kayak designed for rough sea conditions and heavy loads.

Highly stable (initial & secondary)  Sea kayak of moderate weight (52 LB).      
For almost any sized paddler apx (100 to 240 lbs) with beginner and up skills.

http://www.epinions.com/otdr_Kayaking_Touring_Sea-Eddyline-Wind_Dancer

-------   AVAILABLE

      

 

KAYAK #2:       Necky Eliza Plastic, Fire Color, Rudder Equipped 15'-3.5'' @ 22"wide.

Stable and predictable Transitional type moderate weight (49 LB) ladies kayak      
Small to Medium sized paddler (100 - 175 lbs) with Beginner and up skills.       
This is the heavier model and largest cockpit of the Eliza series.   http://www.frontenac-outfitters.com/kayaks/one_boat.cfm?ID=706   

--- -       ---   AVAILABLE

 

KAYAK #3:     Necky Eliza Advanced Composite (Un Modified), Red and White, Skeg Version 15'-3'' @ 21" wide.

Stable and predictable Transitional type Light weight (45 LB) Ladies Kayak.

Small to Medium sized paddler (100 - 175 lbs) with Beginner and up skills.       
This is the medium size cockpit of the Eliza series.

http://www.frontenac-outfitters.com/kayaks/one_boat.cfm?ID=702

--- ---  AVAILABLE

 

KAYAK #4:       Necky Eliza Composite Special Ultra Light Version (Very Thin         Fiberglass and now with reinforced floor), Yellow, Skeg Version 15'-3'' @ 21" wide. 

Stable and predictable Transitional type Light weight (40 LB) Ladies Kayak.      
Small to Medium sized paddler (100 - 175 lbs) with Beginner and up skills.       
This is the lightest of the Eliza Series and also with the smallest cocpit. 

http://playak.com/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&catid=5010:boats&id=2150:Eliza-Ultralite

http://www.neckykayaks.com/press_room/press_releases/eliza_paddlerspick/

--- ---  AVAILABLE


                
KAYAK #5:    Wood Cedar Strip Night Heron by Guillemot Kayaks, Fixed Skeg 18' @ 20" wide.

Overall a stable and predictable Sea Kayak with a hard chine, low rocker Greenland style hull (50 lbs). 

Greenland style Paddle available also if specifically REQUESTED. 

http://www.cricketdesigns.com/greenland.htm       .

Medium Sized Paddler (apx 150 - 220 Lbs) with NOVICE/INTERMEDIATE and up skills. 

http://www.guillemot-kayaks.com/guillemot/node/30/detail

--- RESERVED FOR KAREN  ---   *

      

 

KAYAK #6:        NDK Greenlander Pro Fiberglass, Red, Skeg Equipped. Greenland style, fast kayak for ocean crusing. 18' @ 21" wide

Low initial but moderated secondary stability when on full edge. Medium sized paddler (150-200 lbs) with  a MINIMUM of Intermediate to Advanced sea paddling skills needed for this boat. 

http://www.maineislandkayak.com/ndk_greenlander.html#greenlanderpro

        ---??---  I will use this one if the others are taken, al-r.


KAYAK #7:    *OR*    SPACE TAKEN ON THE TRAILER is:       RESERVED 

 

al-r
item.how_to_find_us: Look for me wearing my ORANGE HUNTING HAT and orange crock.

item.name: SEPT 3 KAYAKING @ BRANDFORD HARBOUR to Farm River areas & POT LUCK BBQ* HCR-SK
